intro: Haloragis longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or damp environments, such as swamps and riverbanks. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are usually pink or red, attracting various pollinators. Haloragis longifolia is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
